Package org.gradle.api.execution

Interface TaskExecutionListener

All Known Implementing Classes:
TaskExecutionAdapter
@Deprecated public interface TaskExecutionListener
Deprecated.
This type is not supported when configuration caching is enabled.

A TaskExecutionListener is notified of the execution of the tasks in a build.

You can add a TaskExecutionListener to a build using TaskExecutionGraph.addTaskExecutionListener(org.gradle.api.execution.TaskExecutionListener)

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    afterExecute(Task task, TaskState state)
    Deprecated.
    This method is called immediately after a task has been executed.
    void

    Deprecated.
    This method is called immediately before a task is executed.

  • Method Details

    • beforeExecute

      void beforeExecute(Task task)
      Deprecated.
      This method is called immediately before a task is executed.
      Parameters:
      task - The task about to be executed. Never null.

    • afterExecute

      void afterExecute(Task task, TaskState state)
      Deprecated.
      This method is called immediately after a task has been executed. It is always called, regardless of whether the task completed successfully, or failed with an exception.
      Parameters:
      task - The task which was executed. Never null.
      state - The task state. If the task failed with an exception, the exception is available in this state. Never null.
